title: NaviAirway: a Bronchiole-sensitive Deep Learning-based Airway Segmentation Pipeline. (arXiv:2203.04294v3 [eess.IV] UPDATED)
abstract: Airway segmentation is essential for chest CT image analysis. Different from natural image segmentation, which pursues high pixel-wise accuracy, airway segmentation focuses on topology. The task is challenging not only because of its complex tree-like structure but also the severe pixel imbalance among airway branches of different generations. To tackle the problems, we present a NaviAirway method which consists of a bronchiole-sensitive loss function for airway topology preservation and an iterative training strategy for accurate model learning across different airway generations. To supplement the features of airway branches learned by the model, we distill the knowledge from numerous unlabeled chest CT images in a teacher-student manner. Experimental results show that NaviAirway outperforms existing methods, particularly in the identification of higher-generation bronchioles and robustness to new CT scans. Moreover, NaviAirway is general enough to be combined with different backbone

tldr: NaviAirway是一种基于深度学习的支气管敏感性气道分割方法，其具有一种支气管敏感损失函数，以保持气道的拓扑结构，并具有迭代训练策略，以便模型跨不同气道代学习，其优于现有方法，特别是在高代支气管的识别和对新CT扫描的鲁棒性方面表现卓越。
en_tdlr: NaviAirway is a deep learning-based bronchiole-sensitive airway segmentation method with a bronchiole-sensitive loss function for preserving airway topology and iterative training strategy for learning accurate models across different airway generations. The method outperforms existing methods, particularly in identifying higher-generation bronchioles and exhibiting robustness to new CT scans.
